column4: were is the bash interpreter? Im looking to start a file with #!/usr/wherever/bash/is
which bash
obey_me: I dont know :| Im running echo and rsync, pretty much
just run "which bash" in a terminal.. which tells you where the binary is
bigrigger, obey_me: Okay, I got it. Thanks guys.
is it the same for windows, then?
no, ext3 is a bit more clever about where it puts the file blocks compared to ntfs..
ah. okay. I was partially correct, then
thanks
I've only heard of people having fragmentation problems with almost full drives that have files written, deleted, grown constantly.. mail queues and such..
but if you keep at least 10% free space you wont see any problems for a long time
ah okay. I was wondering why there was no talk about defrag often here. Yeah, I got a huge harddisk I hardly use any part of.
in system, preferences, sound
I did change that, and it works for most things, but things like firefox still play through onboard
and the audio applet still controls onboard, too
ah.. it's probably pulseaudio then.. run this in a terminal "sudo apt-get install padevchooser pavucontrol"

then go to Applications, Sound & Video and find PulseAudio Volume Control.. start that and you'll be able to change where the firefox sound is played.. you have to have a sound playing when you do that though.. so find a webpage, youtube will do, and then adjust the setting.. It should stick so the next time you wont have to change it
k, thanks. ill check that out. man, from what i've heard, pulse audio seems to do more harm than good :/
nah.. it's got its flaws.. but for multiple sound cards it's great
okay, I got that working, but any clue how to get the gnome sound applet to default to controlling the sblive card?
right click on it and select preferences.. there you can select which card it controls

oh, wow. that was ridiculously easy. Sorry about bothering you for that. lol, I thought I would be having to mess with some config stuff to get this working, didn't expect pulse audio to work as well as it did.
thanks for all the help
no worries.. if I didn't want to be bothered I wouldn't be here.. glad it worked out for you
